Detailed Description

Class for handling the statistics packets for SMS Modules.

In addition to the normal header this packet contains {tabular}{lll} Pos & Size & \ HEADER_SIZE & 4 bytes & Statistics +4 & 4 bytes & nbrMaps ( always == 0 ) +8 & 2 bytes & Number of phonenumbers for this module = X. +10 & 2 bytes & Number of servicenames for this module = Y. +12 & string*X & The phone numbers for this module. ?? & string*Y & The service names for this module. {tabular}

Definition at line 75 of file StatisticsPacket.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SMSStatisticsPacket::SMSStatisticsPacket (  const IPnPort &  address,
const MapSafeVector &  stats,
int  queueLength,
uint16  numberOfPhones,
char **  phoneNumbers,
uint16  numberOfServices,
char **  services
) 
 

Creates a new SMSStatisticsPacket.

Parameters:
address The ip and port of the available module sending the packet.
stats The MapSafeVector.
numberOfPhones The number of phonenumbers that the SMSModule can send SM:s to.
phoneNumbers The phonenumbers that the SMSModule can send short messages to.
numberOfServices The number of services for the SMSModule.
services The services of the SMSModule. If a service name is here the leader will send SM:s that have that name for phonenumber to this module.

Returns the number of services of the SMSStatisticsPacket.

Returns:
The number of services.

void SMSStatisticsPacket::getPhonesAndServices (  char *  phoneNumbers[],
char *  serviceNames[]
)  const
 

Use this function to read out the service names.

First call getNumberOfServiceNames and allocate a buffer to store the pointers in. NB: No copies are made. The pointers point into the packet.

Parameters:
phoneNumbers An array to put the phoneNumberpointers into.
serviceNames An array to put the pointers to the service names into.
Returns:
The number of services
